intro: Eurystyles cornu-bovis, commonly known as the horned buckbean, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, branched inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and can be found in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in spikes. The species is notable for its unique appearance and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
